header: Criminal Bail Application No. 134/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000506­2019 Navnath Vaijnath Gadekar …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent.

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 This is the first bail application by accused Navnath Vaijnath Gadekar, in connection with C.R.No.386/2018, registered by Shivajinagar police station, for the offences punishable under section 353, 504, 506, 279 of IPC and under section 119/177, 3, 5, 177, 181 and 129 of the Motor Vehicles Act.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 119/177, 3, 5, 177, 181 and 129 of the Motor Vehicles Act

arguments.text: [2] Perused the say given at Exh.4. [3] Heard learned advocate Mr. Gadade for the applicant / accused and APP Mr. Aurangabadkar for the State.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Perused the say given at Exh.4.
[3] Heard learned advocate Mr. Gadade for the applicant / accused and APP Mr. Aurangabadkar for the State.

arguments.text: [4] Learned advocate Mr. Gadade argued that accused is falsely implicated in the present crime. He is innocent and it may be the case that there were exchange of words in a heat of moment, but now the authorities are applying section 353 of IPC just because the offence is made triable by the Sessions Court. He submitted that having regard to the nature of the offence and the fact that the accused / applicant is arrested on 27­12­2018, the accused may be released on bail. He is ready to abide any condition impose on him.

argumentSentences.text: [4] Learned advocate Mr. Gadade argued that accused is falsely implicated in the present crime.

He is innocent and it may be the case that there were exchange of words in a heat of moment, but now the authorities are applying section 353 of IPC just because the offence is made triable by the Sessions Court.
He submitted that having regard to the nature of the offence and the fact that the accused / applicant is arrested on 27­12­2018, the accused may be released on bail.
He is ready to abide any condition impose on him.

arguments.text: [5] Per­contra, learned APP argued that the offence in question is serious in nature. The accused / applicant has taken law in his hand and obstructed the public servant in discharging his official duty. He prayed that application be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: [5] Per­contra, learned APP argued that the offence in question is serious in nature.
The accused / applicant has taken law in his hand and obstructed the public servant in discharging his official duty.
He prayed that application be rejected.

arguments.text: [6] I have gone through the FIR and allegations made therein. Having regard to the nature of the crime, the role alleged to have been played by the accused / applicant in commission of the crime and the fact that the accused / applicant is behind bar since 27­12­2018, I find that accused / applicant is entitled for bail. Hence, following order.

argumentSentences.text: [6] I have gone through the FIR and allegations made therein.

Having regard to the nature of the crime, the role alleged to have been played by the accused / applicant in commission of the crime and the fact that the accused / applicant is behind bar since 27­12­2018, I find that accused / applicant is entitled for bail.

order.text: ORDER [1] The application is allowed. [2] The applicant Navnath Vaijnath Gadekar is released on bail, on his executing PR Bond of Rs.15,000/­, with one surety of like amount, in connection with C.R.No. 386/2018 registered by Shivajinagar police station, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant / accused shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant / accused shall co­operate the investigating agency during investigation and he shall not repeat any offence. [C] The applicant / accused shall attend the court regularly during trial. [3] Bail before concerned JMFC.

processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No. 134/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000506­2019 Navnath Vaijnath Gadekar …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 This is the first bail application by accused Navnath Vaijnath Gadekar, in connection with C.R.No.386/2018, registered by Shivajinagar police station, for the offences punishable under section 353, 504, 506, 279 of IPC and under section 119/177, 3, 5, 177, 181 and 129 of the Motor Vehicles Act. 
---background-ends---
[2] Perused the say given at Exh.4. [3] Heard learned advocate Mr. Gadade for the applicant / accused and APP Mr. Aurangabadkar for the State. 
---argument-ends---
[4] Learned advocate Mr. Gadade argued that accused is falsely implicated in the present crime. He is innocent and it may be the case that there were exchange of words in a heat of moment, but now the authorities are applying section 353 of IPC just because the offence is made triable by the Sessions Court. He submitted that having regard to the nature of the offence and the fact that the accused / applicant is arrested on 27­12­2018, the accused may be released on bail. He is ready to abide any condition impose on him. 
---argument-ends---
[5] Per­contra, learned APP argued that the offence in question is serious in nature. The accused / applicant has taken law in his hand and obstructed the public servant in discharging his official duty. He prayed that application be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
[6] I have gone through the FIR and allegations made therein. Having regard to the nature of the crime, the role alleged to have been played by the accused / applicant in commission of the crime and the fact that the accused / applicant is behind bar since 27­12­2018, I find that accused / applicant is entitled for bail. Hence, following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] The application is allowed. [2] The applicant Navnath Vaijnath Gadekar is released on bail, on his executing PR Bond of Rs.15,000/­, with one surety of like amount, in connection with C.R.No. 386/2018 registered by Shivajinagar police station, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant / accused shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant / accused shall co­operate the investigating agency during investigation and he shall not repeat any offence. [C] The applicant / accused shall attend the court regularly during trial. [3] Bail before concerned JMFC. 
---order-ends---
Pune, Dated/­14­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Cri.B.A.No. 134/19 3 CNR No.MHPU01­000506­2019 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Shri. V. V.
